website_summaries.verdict: An attractive bassinet at a mid-range price that doubles as a convenient co-sleeper.
pros: An attractive, well-made bassinet that can be attached to an adult mattress for easy access to baby
It stands out for its see-through mesh sides and ample storage space
cons: The co-sleeping attachment can be a bit difficult to attach if you have a heavy mattress

customer_reviews.title: This cosleeper has been one of the most practical items ...
customer_reviews.text: This cosleeper has been one of the most practical items I own. It has made breast feeding and co sleeping so much easier. I feel so safe knowing she's laying right next to me but not quite on the same bed where anything can happen. Loooove it!
customer_reviews.author: michael maldonad o

customer_reviews.title: It's just ok.
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed that there's no way to get the mattress flush with my mattress. That was really the whole reason I bought this thing. But, you will always have to reach over the little bar to get to your baby. Also, for this price it should REALLY come with the leg extensions. Charging an extra $20 for the extensions is poor customer service. This thing is short, and not made to reach the same height as an adult bed. My bed is not tall at all, and I had to use the whole extension kit to get it lined up.
customer_reviews.author: not a novice

customer_reviews.title: Defective product.  Should be pulled from this site.
customer_reviews.text: Our product was defective. One of the side rails doesn't lock into place, making it frustrating as well as a death trap. From what I see on Amazon, this is a problem that a lot of people have experienced. Also, having to deal with sending a large item back and rushing to find a new crib is infuriating. I only gave it one star because I am unable to submit a zero-star review on a product that has zero use. Edit: customer service from Arms Reach contacted us and was incredibly snotty, insisting that the only reason anyone has ever had trouble with this product is because they didn’t follow the directions.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a first time mom and can honestly say that it is very helpful. During tired nights I could just reach over and grab my baby. It is also very helpful that you can put it in your room then move it to different areas of the home. The only thing is that the bed was a bit rough for my baby and had to purchase a bit softer mattress which helped by baby sleep through the night.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Servin

customer_reviews.title: It ain't pretty but it's great!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for two reasons: It had wheels and had a canopy (we were worried about our cat jumping in). When it first arrived, I was disappointed because it's not cute looking. There's all this netting on it and there's nothing precious or baby-like about it. BUT - we absolutely love it now. All the compartments are SO convenient. We store the extra sheets below and are able to load up the side pockets with receiving blankets. The fitted sheet is sometimes a bit of a pain to put on but it's not a deal breaker. It was a little complicated to put together but we haven't had any issues with durability. Our cat has never jumped inside. :)
customer_reviews.author: ImJustAGal

customer_reviews.title: Great cosleeper
customer_reviews.text: Loved this cosleeper. Makes it super easy to bring baby into bed with you for nightly feedings, especially postpartum. I loved all the storage, I had everything I needed right by my bed, because who likes getting out of bed for every diaper change/feeding/clothing change? Only slight complaint would be the maneuvering of the side that comes down, I always had difficulty getting it back up. Also makes a great bed when baby needs to sleep elsewhere (another room, grandparents house, hotel, etc)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad we got this
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad we got this. I don't have to get out of bed to nurse baby in the middle of the night, and I can reach over and see how she's doing at any time. It's expensive, but worth it. We do have a high-ish bed, so we had to buy the leg extension kit. The area underneath has a zipper (on the opposite side from the side that drops) where you can store sheets and such. The little pockets on the shorter ends are good for things like a diaper clutch or extra pacifiers.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have a taller than average bed
customer_reviews.text: If your bed is tall, you're going to have a problem with the whole "arm's reach" concept. The bassinet is still useable but you will have to get out of bed anyway if you have a tall bed. The bassinet is firm, to the extent that I think my baby was uncomfortable as she hated the thing. I do like the mesh sides however, and storage. Overall Meh.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Winter Rose

customer_reviews.title: I love this! It’s so convenient and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It’s so convenient and very sturdy. Unfortunately, my baby doesn’t like it because she doesn’t like to lay flat, however I would definitely recommend this for others! My biggest complaint is that it doesn’t easily move away from the bed for me to get out of bed, i have to crawl/scoot to the end of the bed to get out. Since the baby is so close to me, and there are storage pouches in the cosleeper, I don’t have to get up in the middle of the night often though.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna M.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice & convenient. Set up is tricky.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions to set this up were confusing but once it's set up it's very nice. It's been very convenient to have my baby super close and not have to get up in the middle of the night to get him. I'm confident that he's safe in his own space and I can check on him easily. I love the storage underneath for extra diapers, swaddles, sleepers, breast pump, etc. The mesh pockets on the sides are great for diapers, wipes, and diaper cream. It's easy to detach from the bed to change the bedsheets or vacuum. Overall, I'm very happy with this. Just wish the set up instructions were better.
customer_reviews.author: TechTestimony

customer_reviews.title: Baby’s right next to you.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for keeping baby next to you to sleep. It’s easy to pick them up out of to feed. It’s just like a pack and play when it comes to folding up. I love having my baby right there next to me all night. The side that’s down still is about 6 inches tall so there is no worry of baby rolling out getting hurt. My ONLY complaint is that you have to pay extra for the leg extenders if it’s not tall enough to meet the side of your bed which are an extra $20 or so. Otherwise it’s just what I needed to keep my newborn close wighought being in my bed at night.
customer_reviews.author: YumeHokuto

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful to be able to see baby anytime during the night
customer_reviews.text: I love my arm's reach co-sleeper! Been using it with my newborn for a month now and I love just looking over to the side and being able to see him and keep an eye on him all night. He also really likes being able to look at me when he's trying to fall asleep. All the benefits of co-sleeping but without the worry of rolling on to baby or hurting them somehow in your sleep. Will recommend this to all my friends when they have their children.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Two Thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to purchase something that would function as a sidecar without the extra bulk. I was however sad to see the side rail break untouched by anything. The hinge no longer locks with just over 5 months of use. It was purchased prior to babies arival so of course is past the 6 month warranty. Save yourself the extra expense and buy a reliable crib. Not only did it break but the thing is incredibly firm and stains are not easily removed.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the best co sleeper that I’ve purchased. It’s easy to assemble. It can operate as a freestanding pack and play or a co-sleeper attached to the bed. It’s smaller than a typical pack and play, about the same size as a bassinet. It has mesh sidings and the side comes down for bedside attachment. My only con is the mattress pad. It’s very thin and hard.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena E

customer_reviews.title: I’m glad I went with this!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to set up and break down, easy to clean, and my kid still sleeps in it at 15 lbs and 25 inches long. I haven’t been worried about it collapsing once. My son needed a little extra padding after awhile but I think that’s simply his preference.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Williams

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: Very short...I am unsure if anyone's bed is this short? But overall, it is pretty easy to maneuver and use. Baby will not sleep in this without his dock-a-tot though. When I laid him in this as a newborn, swaddled, he would go to one side of his body or the other, and would not lay on his back. At least in his dock-a-tot, he stays on his back.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the reviews says
customer_reviews.text: I purchase arms reach concept for my grandson, the first week of using it, the crap has started sinking in the middle. My grandaughter is so scare to put the baby back in his bed because shes afraid the baby is gonna fall right down the middle. im packing the crap and sending back. very dissapointed in NY... by the way now the baby is sleeping in the bed with mom, which its not good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for baby but heavy to move
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this cosleeper for my first two children and now will be using it again with my third. It’s height is adjustable, the pieces are easy to click together. It’s not difficult to put together once you do it a few times, which you may not even have to unless you travel and plan to take it with you. It’s not the simplest cosleeper to move around the house, it’s best to keep in one spot. The spot where baby lays is easy to wash but the frantic along the rest of the sleeper has never been washed, which I would’ve loved to have be able to wash easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Marken

customer_reviews.title: Broken parts
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with broken pieces and arms would not lock. Sent out for a replacement. Will update review when received. Update: processed the return and ups picked it up from my house the next day. Was extremely easy. Got the replacement two days later. Everything was as it should be. After reading other reviews for advice on assembly it was done very easily. Sturdy and right height for our bed. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: This one was a pain to actually attach to the bed and even with extended feet the height was never quite right. The mattress itself was not comfortable and our infant hated it. It wound up being more work than it was worth for me to pick her up in and out of it bc we couldn’t get it to align with our bed properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect co sleeper
customer_reviews.text: Love this co sleeper. Bought this after having a different kind because it was hard for me to bend to pick baby up. Loved that this lays right up against the bed and was high enough for our bed. Love how compact it is, it was easy to take it with us on trips for hotel stays.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. P.

customer_reviews.title: One of a kind
customer_reviews.text: Perfect option for bedsharing wannabes like me. I can have my space, move freely blankets and all, and baby is just arms reach away for nursing in the night. Eased my worries of having newborn in bed.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t touch my bed like I thought it would but it’s close. The sheet is terrible though. It’s an odd, uncomfortable texture and it gathers dust and other stuff extremely easy.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for mothers who are more comfortable with being next ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for mothers who are more comfortable with being next to their baby while sleeping but don t want to share the bed due to SIDS, has storage slits on sides and underneath
customer_reviews.author: Review Queen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mini crib
customer_reviews.text: We have no space for a crib at the moment and this was perfect. It is bigger than your average bassinet. My child is Four months old and is longer than most children her age and she still fits comfortably. There is also room in the bottom to so store some clothes or extra diapers. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: ... play or a traditional bassinet and this was the best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't decide between a pack and play or a traditional bassinet and this was the best of both worlds. It folds like a pack and play if you need to move it but it is larger than the traditional bassinet and baby won't outgrow it as fast. My son slept in this until he was 4 months old. It makes night time feedings so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the Wirecutter recommendation. I was very disappointed because the model I got was defective. One of the sides wouldn’t lock into place, making the entire thing useless. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Lyss

customer_reviews.title: Well made works great!
customer_reviews.text: We love this co sleeper! My son uses this every day. It keeps him right next to me all night so i know hes ok & when he wakes up to breasfeed in middle of night i can pull him right in to bed w/ me. Im never worried its going to tip over etc. Its very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: april lynn

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very shaky. My son would move his leg and the entire thing would shake. It was difficult to move around. The mattress was extremely thin and never laid flat. It was also difficult to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Logan

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for C-Section Mommas
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had this for my first born. Recovering from a c-section and I was still having issues 11 weeks pp so I decided to try this. Definitely recommend for c-section moms!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi F.

customer_reviews.title: I’m disappointed it’s so short and the leg extenders are so ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed it’s so short and the leg extenders are so expensive. Otherwise we like the bed so far!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: I can’t review since it was giving as a gift from a registry.
customer_reviews.author: rd

customer_reviews.title: Only assemblable by Thor or the hulk
customer_reviews.text: Why the hell are the sides so hard to snap into place. I will never put this up again once it's disassembled. Good luck to whoever buys this from me on ebay
customer_reviews.author: It's just me

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: Defective unit. Upper arm would not stay locked so the whole thing would collapse. Had to send back and buy a different bassinet in store due to arrival of baby.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter in law loves it! Ty! Using it for second baby now! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Deb Becker

customer_reviews.title: i could have been satisfied with any simple 50 $ bassinet
customer_reviews.text: too expensive. connecting it to the bed is an issue. you have to have a certain hight and certain style of beds. I ended up not attaching it to bed and not using this feature. too heavy. i could have been satisfied with any simple 50 $ bassinet.
customer_reviews.author: De Fors

customer_reviews.title: I love my babies arms reach co sleeper
customer_reviews.text: I love my babies arms reach co sleeper, it is very easy to move and love the breathable sides to it. I have found it hard to find quilted sheets for UT my sister gave me hers to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dkhill

customer_reviews.title: Love this it makes life so much easier with babies
customer_reviews.text: Love this it makes life so much easier with babies! I've now used it with both of my babies and love it! So I helped my brother get one when he had a kid
customer_reviews.author: Kat Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great Co-sleeper just a little on the small side
customer_reviews.text: I love this co-sleeper! It’s super convenient and you can take it to go. The only complaint that I have is that it is kinda small. I have a 4 month old and he looks like he’s getting ready to grow out of it, so probably can only keep it until he is 6 Months Old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happpy we chose it
customer_reviews.text: Totally love this thing. We have toddlers anf they try to pull themselves up to see the baby and they have never pulled ot over. I love the storage underneath for diapers and wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Jilli Bo

customer_reviews.title: Meets high expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter’s first baby. They are very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Stone

customer_reviews.title: Love this crib
customer_reviews.text: Love this crib, I love that it has a compartment at the bottom and pockets on the sides. Unfortunately baby doesn't like it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Martinez

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay...
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, needs wheels on both ends, and difficult to put together (for same reason as others described, sides wouldn’t lock). Afraid to collapse it for travel because of difficulty in putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: My baby hates flat surfaces but doesn’t really matters in terms to the bassinet. It’s a MUST for breastfeeding moms
customer_reviews.author: Joni Howard

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and compact. Also sturdier than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: It's great that the side folds down for easy access at the bedside and folds like a pack-n-play for travel. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: AmandaS72

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bassinet. Haven’t opened it yet but I used the same one for my other two kids.
customer_reviews.author: Abi Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Lite but safe And sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This has been best baby product I’ve purchased. It’s super easy to assemble, it’s light and easy to move around and it’s awesome to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very easy to set up and we can't wait to use it on our new baby girl <3
customer_reviews.author: Amy L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love my co-sleeper! Fits perfect bed side at home and in our motor home.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to assemble. We're sending this PITA back!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst baby product on the face of the planet. My husband and I spent an hour, just trying to get the top bars to lock and no matter what we tried, we could not. Only 3 of the 4 sides would lovk. Watched YouTube videos, downloaded pdf assembly instructions etc. Now that's it's unpacked, it now won't fold down to return. Save your time and get something else. Luckily, we went through this frustration without being sleep deprived. If you're a masochist, please, order this PITA.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Song

customer_reviews.title: Love it ! Dont like matress.
customer_reviews.text: Love this bassinet !!! Easy for me to see my daughter and makes me feel better about sleeping. My father put this together for me so I'm not sure how hard it was to assemble, but it didn't take him more than a couple hours. The only thing I don't like it how hard the matress is. I also wish it could be adjustable in height.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Dabby

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this. I wish it had something to put my items, as it replaced my nightstand.
customer_reviews.author: G. Recipient

customer_reviews.title: One side is defective
customer_reviews.text: One side of the cosleeper that is supposed to clip into place wont. Theres a button you can feel to push to take it down but its jammed up so it wont lock into place, just keeps collapsing. Im due with my son today and once hes born i cant put him in this thing now. I threw out the boxes it cane in before totally assembling and realizing its defective
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy for parents and comfortable for baby
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have bought in the last four years for a new grand baby. The company keeps improving this product and the original was great!
customer_reviews.author: DCR

customer_reviews.title: Twins
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect gift for my friend. She and her new twins are very happy!
customer_reviews.author: KRYSTAL AHDERS

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to receive this bassinet. Upon assembling (which was not easy to begin with), we discovered the last small side arm that needed to lock would not lock whatsoever. It was broken. Trying to then unlock the three already locked arms was even more difficult. The lock mechanism was broken.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Carwile

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: My baby did not like this. He’s a newborn and yuh could tell he still felt far away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: we love this crib. less hassle, easy To handle and gives comfort to our little angel. Thanks alot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: One side will not lock. Have to send it back. Seems like a lot of people have this issue. Item definitely defective.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the bassinet. Whoever the storage underneath isn't convenient to get to
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Garvin

customer_reviews.title: Only thing that's an issue is that the mattress is ...
customer_reviews.text: Only thing that's an issue is that the mattress is not washable. It has pressboard (basically hard cardboard) in it that cannot be removed for washing. if they changed it so that one can access the pressboard in order to remove it for washing, it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: MM2024

customer_reviews.title: It’s a defective product!
customer_reviews.text: I feel headache when assembly the cosleeper! Two side of short bar cannot lock well and keep on collapsing! Finally I found other buyers had same experience as me ! It’s really upset because my expected date is coming and it is not enough time to prepare new bed!
customer_reviews.author: ISABEL

customer_reviews.title: Diaper table changing pad fits perfectly inside!!
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of this is Co sleeper is super hard, but I put my foam diaper changing pad into and it fits perfectly! Plus side the changing pad covers are cheaper than sheets and the diaper pad is wipable!!! Best ever because they will ruin mattress otherwise. My baby sleeps in this every night. Best thing I've bought! Love having my bed back and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: This came damaged; one of the sides would not ...
customer_reviews.text: This came damaged; one of the sides would not lock in place. Safety risk. Ordered another one, we will see if this replacement is defective
customer_reviews.author: Michelle F

customer_reviews.title: only because I think it's annoying that ill have to purchase an extension kit to ...
customer_reviews.text: I adore this thing! It's a bit short, in my opinion, 5 inches or so shorter than my bed which is just a standard pillowtop, but it still works. I give 3.5 stars, only because I think it's annoying that ill have to purchase an extension kit to make it fit my bed properly.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Received today, I am due any day and 2 of the railings do not lock! Piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Newborn loves it. We don't use as cosleeper - just stand alone. Takes a few trys to open & collapse but you get the hang of it. Main thing is the bottom pull switch has to be in 'collapsed' mode in order to get the 4 railings to lock in - this can be frustrating when you have a crying baby & a frustrated spouse. It's great all around tho & would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for newborns
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was born with really bad reflux and I didn't feel comfortable with her being away from my side, she would choke on her own vomit while sleeping. I was too paranoid to bed share and wasn't ready to side-car her crib yet and this was the perfect solution! my only complaint would be how thin and hard the mattress pad inside of it is but that didn't bother my her until she was 3 months old and by then we were ready to switch her to the crib. Will definitely be using with my future babies, too! I would recommend this to all parents of newborns ♥
customer_reviews.author: Mandie

customer_reviews.title: It came broken. One of the rails does not ...
customer_reviews.text: It came broken . One of the rails does not lock in place which is a hazard .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bassinet
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Comes with a travel bag. Has plenty of storage in the bottom as well as two pockets on each os the smaller ends.
customer_reviews.author: AvyG

product_meta.title: Arm's Reach Concepts Mini Ezee 2-in-1 Bedside Bassinet - Natural
product_meta.description: Arm's Reach has been marketing our Award Winning patented Co-Sleeper bedside bassinets since 1997. Since then, we have continued to update styling, but our product has remained true to its original mission. Like all of our Co-Sleeper bedside bassinets, the Co-Sleeper Mini Ezee 2 in 1 is a safe way to bond with your infant as soon as they come home for the first time. The Arm's Reach Co-Sleeper Mini Ezee 2 in 1 is the embodiment of what we're all about. After years of customer feedback and product developments this is truly an ideal option for any concerned parent. The Mini Ezee 2 in 1 comes with more ventilation for even better breathability. Simple assembly that saves time and it's portable. Side pockets for storage, a 4-inch sleeping nest height, and an attachment strap and resistant plate to provide the safest sleep solution for you and your newborn. easily into a nylon carrying case with sturdy carrying strap. The bedside sleeper and the bassinet modes are for infants of up to approximately 5 months in age or when the child begins to push up on hands and knees, whichever occurs first.
feature_bullets: Simple assembly that saves time and it's portable. Discontinued use of the product when child is able to climb out or reaches the height of 35 inches
Side pockets and bottom compartment for storage
4-inch sleeping nest height, and an attachment strap and resistant plate to provide the safest sleep solution for you and your newborn
The bedside sleeper and the bassinet modes are for infants of up to approximately 5 months in age
Federal standards require no more than a 1/2 inch (13mm) gap between bedside sleeper and an adult bed. With strap and plate, will fit snugly and safely in co-sleeper mode.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars171 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
